Home → Parents, carers and children → Lydia: the wild girl of Pride & Prejudice, by Natasha Farrant

Lydia: the wild girl of Pride & Prejudice, by Natasha Farrant

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Dec 17, 2016

Every day until Christmas Eve, stock team member and book expert Jo Dixon will recommend a great title for children. Today’s book is Lydia: the wild girl of Pride & Prejudice, by Natasha Farrant.

“Lydia can’t stand her country life - but adventure is just around the corner. Soon, she’s swept off her feet by dashing Wickham, following him glamorous Brighton. Here, a pair of aristocratic twins offer her the life she thinks she seeks. But can she find out what she really wants - and get it?”

This is one of our children's books advent calendar suggestions for 2016. See the whole calendar →

Jo Dixon

I work for Suffolk Libraries Stock Team.

More Children's books

  • Borrow a brilliant children's or YA book from the 2019 UKLA Book Awards shortlist
  • Woodbridge and Lowestoft libraries choose: Tom's Midnight Garden, by Philippa Pearce
  • Bury St Edmunds Library choose: The Secret Garden, by Frances Hodgson Burnett
  • Haverhill Library choose: Oi Dog!, by Kes & Claire Grey & Jim Field
  • Aldeburgh Library choose: Another Year of Plumdog, by Emma Chichester Clark
  • Mildenhall Library choose: The Wonky Donkey, by Craig Smith & Katz Cowley
  • Framlingham Library choose: Owl Babies, by Martin Waddell & Patrick Benson
  • Hadleigh Library choose: The Cat in the Hat, by Dr Seuss
  • Halesworth Library choose: Potkin and Stubbs, by Sophie Green & Karl James Mountford
  • Sudbury Library choose: How To Train Your Dragon, by Cressida Cowell
